Author: 21 June 2019
Review: This film is a rare gem
Review_Url:
It is truly a rarity to come across a modern classic like this that is both educational and entertaining. The black passenger in this film will surprise you from start to finish and so will the white driver. This duo played very well together and this has the right amount of action along with a good story line to satisfy you!
For the most part the black passenger is the type of good mentor that makes up for the white drivers bad influence!
What a dynamic duo. What a riveting performance from two wonderfully convincing actors. This is a must see that is worthy of the accolades it has received.

Author: 7 February 2019
Review_Url:
Finally!!!
Finally a beautiful movie. Simply beautiful.
This film is a gift.
Now that most movies are just full of gratuitous violence, vulgarity, or simply awful, Green Book offers us an example of old style cinema. A simple but beautiful and captivating story, nicely filmed, with great dialogues, sublime acting, and great music.
Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali are immense, and the chemistry between them is so perfect.
I swear that if this movie loses the Academy Award for best movie in favor of The Favourite (one of the worst movies ever made), I will lose my faith in cinema awards forever.
Magnificent film, don't miss it!

Author: 1 June 2019
Review_Url: I'm getting sick just watching this hot dog content with toppings.

Author: 21 March 2019
Review: Not even close to best picture of 2019
Review_Url: Just like how Crash (not Cronenberg's version) poignantly and blithely reminded us that being a racist can have unforeseen negative consequences with respect to our ever-intertwining lives, theoretically more so now that globalism is at a fever pace, so, too, does Green Book help us understand that despite our different backgrounds, socioeconomic status, and indeed even skin color, life is not fair and if we can change just one person's attitude, then also behavior, by ingesting two-hour flicks, it's almost certainly a win-win situation.

Author: 18 August 2019
Review_Url: A sad reflection of the 1960 s US race situation but well acted and entertaining and a story that does draw you in. Based on a true story which, as so often, is more poinent than fiction.

Author: 25 March 2019
Review: Outstanding and Heart-Warming movie: It's a MUST WATCH
Review_Url: Green Book is not only a well-produced film, but it is also an important one. It transmits an edgy message without over or under exposing it to the viewers, and the story ties together really neatly thanks to the vision of the director and the outstanding performances from both of the main leads. This film should be watched by everyone, as it is as important to our society today as it is a funny and entertaining road trip movie.

Author: 24 February 2020
Review_Url: What do we do with bones ? Great movie great acting . No reason to not see this movie .

Author: 28 January 2019
Review_Url: Ignoring the controversy surrounding this picture, this is a film that has a fantastic script, which is bolstered by its two leading men. Particular applaudits should go to Ali who continues to shine.

Author: 29 February 2020
Review_Url: Is it the most progressive of movies? No

Author: 3 December 2021
Review_Url: I finally watched it, 3 years after it came out.., so good, had a smile on my face all the time, great film, it definitely deserves the awards it got!

Author: 2 October 2019
Review: Surprisingly gentle exploration of difficult issues
Review_Url: This film is very enjoyable to watch. Given the very difficult issues of discrimination that are at its centre that is quite a surprise. The film in no way undermines the importance of its subject matter by being surprisingly easy to watch, it really is quite a success.

Author: 22 August 2021
Review_Url: What makes this a great movie is the way that it tells the story of how racist's ideas and even hearts can change. It shows the absurdity of the attitudes all too common and that sadly still exist among many, especially in the deep south of the USA. That musicians could not eat or sleep in the very hotels that they were performing in shames America.

Author: 6 January 2019
Review_Url: The movie contains all elements to be called masterpiece: amazing actors, entertaining and deep scenario and good directing! I haven't been exited from a movie since very long time. It must be in everyone's watchlist.

Author: 15 December 2021
Review_Url: It's hard to make a story that involves race or racism these days. There are different ways to tell these stories, and people are fast to say you did it "wrong." To me, this story was very heartfelt and moving and funny at times and dark at times too. Messaging isn't heavy-handed, but it still has things to say about the time period, that place, and the real people behind this story.

Author: 25 October 2020
Review_Url: A great story about an unusual friendship in the 1960s. The greatest strength of this film is the great story that is told through two characters who cannot be more different than they are, but still complement each other perfectly. The two main actors have done an amazing job, especially the great Viggo Mortensen. The way their relationship progresses from the first meeting, where they immediately saw that they could not be different and through a journey where they learn a lot about the other, but also about themselves until the end of the film, I think they succeeded in all intent to present us an unusual duo at a strange time, and to provoke our emotions. I liked the film very much and the more I think about it, the more I realize I can't find any flaw in it. I can understand that someone won't like a movie because of a sensitive topic like racism, but I haven't even personally experienced the film solely through that prism. I think the theme is more geared towards people's relationship to each other, regardless of skin color and place of origin because it doesn't determine what kind of people we are as we can't choose or influence it. However, what kind of people we will be, it is determined exclusively by ourselves through our behavior towards others, our actions and our relationships with people. We influence that very much. Although there are some awkward and unfair scenes due to the theme, at times I got the impression of a feel good film, although I'm not sure that the director (Peter Farrelly is known exclusively for many comedies) aimed at that, but also some scenes made me laugh, and that he certainly wanted to. Considering that it was done according to real people and real friendship, I think that it gained extra weight. I don't know if this will become a classic in a few years, but I was delighted with the film and it was given the maximum rating.

Author: 7 December 2018
Review_Url: What a great gift of a Christmas movie and more! In this time of division, anger and hatred, this picture offered hope and a look at how people can overcome their differences and bigotries. What makes it even better is that it's based on true events. The script was exceptional and the editing moved the storyline along seamlessly. Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali were pitch perfect in their respective roles. Oscar worthy movie and performances. I would urge anyone who would like a positive and inspiring experience to go see this movie. So rare these days.

Author: 4 May 2019
Review_Url: How did this unoriginal snoozer win best picture? A movie like this hinges on character development, and these characters were poorly developed. Someone took a true story and crammed it into a cookie-cutter film about an unlikely pair and the racist south of the 1960s. You gotta do better than that, Hollywood. And the reviewers rating this anything better than a 6 need to go watch some good films. You can start with Driving Miss Daisy.

Author: 30 December 2018
Review_Url: This film is the combination of 42, Hidden Figures, and Bohemian Rhapsody, and captures almost every good thing those films gave us. Dr. Shirley is played impeccably by Mahershala Ali, whose lonely poise is heartbreaking to watch. Viggo Mortenson captures the essence of 1960s New York City in his blundering innocence and assumptions of the world around him. Beautifully shot and directed, the movie is more than an unexpected friendship, it is one of discovery of the other sides of America.

Author: 16 April 2019
Review_Url:
I cannot believe I didnÂ´t watch this movie earlier, but I am so glad I got to it at all. As I have stated before with other movies - for me a very important part of a movie is to make you feel something, anything, stir up some emotions and leave you thinking and debating on some things. Yes, this movie has all of that. It talks about imoprtant issues and gives a glimpse of different sides of humanity.
I do believe that the big part in the success of this movie is on Mortensen and Ali - they did their roles just perfectly, but I was especially impressed with Mortensen.
What is another interesting thing about thos movie is that it often seems like you can predict whatÂ´s gonna happen next, but thatÂ´s not the case and I quite liked that.
Also I just realized in the very end that this was a true story and usually movies make it pretty clear at the very beginning. But that just made it all that much more enjoyable.
When the movie ended I felt sheer happiness and gratitude that I had spent 2 hours of my life looking at an incredible story that took my mind to so many different places and made me feel in many different ways. I fully reccomend this film to everyone.

Author: 2 February 2019
Review: Good film with a good heart
Review_Url: Director Peter Farrelly succeeds in making his first serious drama. It's not perfect but it is captivating and entertaining. Viggo Mortensen, always an under-rated actor, is wonderful as chauffeur Tony "the Lip" Vallelonga, who is from working class Bronx stock, and who has an amazing ability to deal with trouble as a night club bouncer. And as the very posh black concert pianist Don Shirley, Mahershala Ali is also great, in portraying an emotionally repressed artist, who during his tour of the Deep South comes somewhat down to earth. Both men have their eyes opened and have something to teach the other. Some of the characters' darker sides, such as Tony's resorting to violence, and his mafia ties, are shown, and not glossed over, which is refreshing. There are one or two scenes that were a bit preachy, but overall it was a nicely shot and edited, and lovingly made film.

Author: 4 March 2019
Review_Url:
It wone an oscar...hell no...to boring,to pretentious,expecting a master piece,getting a shallow script,acting,directing,lack of drama,lack of fire within
and so on..Typical hollywood these days (for past 20 years),giving 'fast food junk' and political mainstream issues is a guaranteed recipe for an Oscar..
What an illusion...

Author: 31 July 2019
Review: Is it really as progressive as people think?
Review_Url: Here's the thing - this was a fairly enjoyable film to watch. That said, I think it's attempt at telling a progressive story about diversity and acceptance misses the mark. It feel to me more like a movie to help make non people of colour feel good about the "progress we've made" as a society. It's still a black man's story through the lens of a white man. It still has the black man giving in and coming back to the white man at the end. It certainly illustrates overcoming prejudice but, I don't feel like this portrayal goes much further than that.

Author: 2 January 2019
Review_Url: What I enjoyed mostly about this film is the onscreen interaction between V. Mortenson and M. Ali it was natural and funny.

Author: 5 December 2018
Review: Sceptical to start, overwhelmed at the finish
Review_Url: I have to admit I was sceptical when it started, but when it finished... its one of my favourite films now, and the fact it's based on a true story, it highlights how horrible things were in the past and how far we have come with some hilarious moments that had the whole screen laughing! Loved this and it's extremely well acted out by all. Would highly recommend it when it comes out!

Author: 31 January 2023
Review_Url: A kind of inverted driving Miss Daisy. The funny thing is, while more superficially racial and topical then Daisy, it isn't really about race. The genius has something to learn about melting back into humanity from his 'dem dese dos' driver. Shirley was the first musician I was exposed to as a child, a 'white' suburb kid in the 50's, because my dad was into his music, and it influenced me. This movie is full of great samples and ends with a thing by Professor Longhair, whose Tipitina still gets me off. The acting is great. It's an interesting story, sort of corny but compelling. It's touching but never feels particularly manipulative. I had no idea of what an interesting character Shirley was. I just knew the music. Not stylistically, but he reminds me of Keith Jarrett, another classically trained prodigy whose talent went way past his early training. To people like Shirley, whose interior empire and life is music, it's enough for me to listen to his work. But a movie is not an audio recording so we get this view of the man himself. Apparently this is a more or less authentic view too. I hope so. Anyway, great movie.

Author: 29 March 2020
Review_Url:
Based on real people. driving on tour in the SOUTH, 1960s. BLACK pianist.
2 GREAT actors, real, moving. well written script, director.
I loved it.
the story was as expected. BUT WELL DONE. show the face of Racism, segregation. Kindness and integrity.

Author: 5 August 2019
Review_Url: Play Green Book! It is fast and easy to view! A good way to spend your time. Be the best!

Author: 10 June 2020
Review: A great "odd couple" buddy movie with deeper undertones
Review_Url:
Had anyone claimed prior to 2018 that Peter Farrelly - director of Dumb and Dumber, Kingpin, Shallow Hal and other amusing but crass low-brow comedies - would one day directed a movie that would win the Academy Award for Best Picture, it seems unlikely that he or she would have been believed. Nevertheless, this proved to be the case with Green Book, a fictionalised biographical comedy drama charting the unlikely friendship between musician Dr Don Shirley and his driver Tony Lip.
The story follows Shirley and Tony Lip (real name Frank Anthony Vallelonga) as the former hires the latter to drive him around on an eight-week tour of the Deep South. Set in 1962, the plot sees Shirley encountering an entirely unsurprising amount of racism, as he is allowed and paid to perform for white audiences but not allowed to use their toilets. Tony thus acts not only as driver but occasional bodyguard, both physically and verbally defending Shirley from the prejudice and persecution he encounters along the way. But whilst racial issues are an important part of the film, it is as much as anything a buddy movie about a growing friendship between an ill-matched pair, the refined and highly educated intellectual snob Shirley and uncouth, foul-mouthed slob Tony Lip. The film's comic moments (and there are many) derive from the friction between their pair caused by their very different outlooks on many aspects of life, including - frequently - food.
The relationship between Shirley and Tony Lip is the very heart of the film. The success of this is partly a result of the screenplay (written by Farrelly, Tony Lip's son Nick Vellelonga, and Brian Hayes Currie) and partly a result of the acting. Mahershala Ali gives a stunning performance as Dr Don Shirley, making him incredibly charismatic, educated and dignified, a sharp contrast to the uneducated, rough and ready Tony Lip. Viggo Mortenson - who gained weight for the role - is just as well cast and the pair gives entirely naturalistic performances throughout. How true to life the characters and the events of the film are has been the subject of much scrutiny, but within the context of the movie they are perfectly convincing. There are many nice touches: the scene in which Don gets arrested during a gay encounter and Tony gets him released, later shrugging off the incident by saying that he knows from working in New York clubs that it is "a complicated world" is nicely understated. Some commentators have argued that the difficulties of being a black gay man in the nineteen sixties should have been explored, but Shirley reportedly never discussed his sexuality and it isn't the point of the film. The very fact that it doesn't matter to Tony is the point.
In spite of the humour, there is also drama aplenty, with real anger in the casual racism of scenes such as Don being forbidden from using the same toilet as the white men at the venue he plays at, and not being allowed to try on a suit in a shop. It's impossible to watch such scenes without feeling disgusted, both at the racist attitudes and the casual way in which they are prevalent in the places that the protagonists visit. The script addresses the question of why Don exposes himself to such bigotry, and having put up with a great deal on the grounds that he wants to change hearts, he finally takes a stand on the last night of the tour, refusing to play at the establishment unless its manager lets him eat in the restaurant.
Having spent most of his career directing what can most politely (but somewhat inaccurately) be described as screwball comedies, Farrelly shows remarkable taste and restraint here, with crisp, understated direction that showcases the acting and lets the characters speak for themselves. Sean Porter's cinematography makes an asset out of the location filming, reflecting Tony's appreciation of the scenery he finds himself driving through, whilst Kris Bowers' soundtrack is supplemented by tracks from the era, which works really well. Green Book has attracted controversy for its depiction of race, with some arguing that it perpetuates a "white saviour" stereotype; this is a matter that I suspect will be the subject of continued debate, but as a touching portrait of an unlikely friendship between two very different men, the film works extremely well.

Author: 1 December 2018
Review_Url: Let's be honest: the trailer for this film made it look like a typical, Oscar-baiting, end of the year awards contender, and in a way it is. We can't deny it - the Oscars love their films about racists turning from their prejudiced ways, and about people struggling through the atrocities of racism and bigotry, and this trailer just looked like more of the same; it's hard to get excited about a film when it looks like it was put together by a bunch of studio executives whose only thoughts were, "How can we win the Oscar this year?" But if there's one man I have faith in, one man who is a light in a dim, dark world, it's Viggo Mortensen, so I held out hope because if there's one thing Mr. Mortensen doesn't do, it's star in bad movies. And you know what? "Green Book" is most certainly not a bad movie. In fact, it's pretty darn excellent.

Author: 11 February 2020
Review_Url: A very good drama that brings subjects like racism and prejudice in a respectful and interesting way.

Author: 21 April 2019
Review_Url: Green Book is simply a great movie. The acting is excellent. It's always hard to watch any movie that deals with America's awful and forever embarrassing chapter of segregation and the outrageous Jim Crow period. This was deftly handled. My only complaint is that the movie wasn't 15-30 minutes longer.

Author: 27 January 2019
Review_Url: I could hardly wait to finish the movie before writing this review, and I don't write them terribly often. This is just an excellent film all around. It's heartwarming, insightful and moving, but best of all I thought it was very very funny! There aren't too many movies that cover so many bases and do it as expertly as this. If you haven't seen it, definitely add this one to your list.

Author: 16 January 2019
Review_Url: First time of me writing a review but this moige really deservef it. Enaugh reading the reviews or checking the ratings. Go watch the movie and le it it be a marvelous experience

Author: 12 June 2020
Review: An enjoyable watch, but don't expect much to happen
Review_Url: I enjoyed it. Not a great deal happens, but it's well filmed, well written, well acted and emotionally satisfying as the relationship develops between the two odd couple leads. And its sadly still poignant and relevant in our times.

Author: 8 May 2020
Review: Feel-good road-trip movie based on 'Driving Miss Daisy' formula
Review_Url: "Green Book" does a fine job of depicting the rampant disrespect that people of color were shown in the US during 1960's. Main problem is, as politically corrected movie, "Green Book" tries very hard and wants not to offend sacrificing the complexity of one of societies great ills in favor of script clarity. On the other hand, the film's effectiveness is especially due to the talents of the two stars - M. Ali and V. Mortensen, veteran actors who just do not ever give an inferior performance. At the end, it is a heartwarming and enough entertaining movie that shines a light on (a difficult part of) American history without patronizing. A real crowd pleaser.

Author: 15 June 2021
Review_Url: I've seen my fair share of biographies and this one is by far the best. The chemistry between Mortenson and Ali is unsurpassed. Highly recommended.

Author: 22 January 2019
Review: Touched my soul on so many levels
Review_Url: Where to begin. Stunning cast. Stunning screenplay. Felt like i was swept back to the late 60s. Eaisly one of the best bios of a man ive seen in years. Absoulety stunning

Author: 25 September 2020
Review_Url: I saw this at the movies and loved it. I watched it again on Foxtel and loved it. Great cast, director and love that it's based on a true story which is what makes it more special.

Author: 27 January 2019
Review_Url: This movie about an unlikely friendship will grow on you. It reminds one that the way you perceive yourself is much more important than how others actually perceive yourself. Step out of your own head and you just might be surprise how everything is not what you think it is. Vigo has the chops and certainly justifies his Best Actor Nomination and Mahershala too as Best Supporting Actor. You will not be able to tell who is in the Lead or Supporting role :) A movie that will make you laugh and feel good after.

Author: 9 April 2020
Review_Url:
Its about changing the world. How we are biased to people by color. How we assume something and make their image accordingly which makes things complex. The problems and issues we have in the society in a broader way. You have to be the change to see the change. We can get along with the person we think we couldnt by interacting and learning about them. The life in itself over the two months. How we grow when we spend time with virtuos people. The company we keep polishes us to be better people. Money and throne is nothing compared to love and family.
Be the change.!

Author: 10 October 2020
Review_Url: Regardless of your skin colour this film just proves that people can be friends and support each other throughout the hard times and the good times.

Author: 2 January 2019
Review: The most delightful buddy film with a menage a trois ending.
Review_Url: Both Viggo Mortensen and Ali's performances were Oscar-worthy. The character arcs are superb with the initially down-to-earth, uneducated Italian descent escort of effete, world famous pianist Don Shirley not only forming a fast friendship, but taking that friendship to another level in the motel scene, as evidenced by Viggo's final statement to his wife upon his return home.

Author: 10 September 2021
Review: Great representation of the true story
Review_Url: This film was a fun watch. To see some of the issues surrounding rasicm that plagued our world's past really was gut wrenching. The plethora of emotions I felt dealing with the great injustice in our world. But in that backdrop, the beautiful friendship formed became even more significant, making every moment ever so precious.

Author: 21 May 2020
Review: you probably didn't expect you to like this movie.
Review_Url: You know what this story is about, and you know what this journey will go through. You understand that it does not touch anything too deep, but it also shows a lot of straightforwardness. You understand that identity is something that everyone cannot avoid, and how rare it is to understand each other. You will naturally like these characters that are not quite like real people, and you will laugh with the funny or not really funny clips. Maybe it's just using laughter as the first reaction to defuse or hide other feelings. You know that the relationship between the story and the green paper that the title says is not that big, and you probably didn't expect you to like this movie.

Author: 31 December 2019
Review: Vigo M should've won for best actor
Review_Url: Vigo should've won for best actor. I believe him in every role he plays. This performance was really excellent!! Mahersh is an ok actor imo. I don't know why and how he won an Oscar for Moonlight. That award should've gone to one of the other actors in that movie but I guess they were not famous enough.

Author: 15 March 2019
Review_Url: After the big win in Oscar, I got to watch this movie! WOW~ did not disappoint me at all! Absolutely deserve all the awards. The supporting actor, Mahershala Ali, is fantastic!! He was totally immersed into his character. I totally could feel his struggle & pain in his life in the movie. Also, I love all the scenes when he played piano!! For someone who didn't know how to play piano in real life to portray his character so successfully. I was so convinced that he was a real musician. Two thumbs up for this movie!

Author: 13 December 2021
Review: I laughed and cried the whole way through!
Review_Url: Ok so I love a little road trip film.... Little Miss Sunshine was my all-time favourite (pipping Garden State) but then I saw this. I think all the PC hype will stop people from watching but it totally deserves all the Academy Awards and Wins!

Author: 25 March 2020
Review: One Odd Couple for the Road...
Review_Url: This is a fine movie about what makes for friendship across cultures. At the beginning, the gruff 'Tony Lip' Vallelonga played by Viggo Mortensen seems too down with it and streetwise to meaningfully bond with the exalting Doctor Don Shirley as stirringly represented by Mahershala Ali. However, through the course of the narrative, their characters prove to have complementary angles that eventually add up to the 180 degrees needed for a stable friendship.

Author: 22 December 2019
Review_Url:
Great acting , great sentiment and lots of laughs
You will enjoy this one

Author: 31 October 2019
Review: The best part is Aragorn making the badass
Review_Url:
Boring and unmeaningful movie for the masses. Multiple scenes are very obvious and the whole movie is built on stereotypes. The story (or how it is depicted here) is quite ordinary. There's maybe one scene that puts light on the real problem. No other insights or complexity, thus the movie is too long. You can watch the first 30 mins and you are able to tell the whole story.
Very bad and absolutely not comparable to 12 years as slave or other movies on the subject.

Author: 6 May 2020
Review_Url: The score and soundtrack is amazing and Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali give great performances, worth awards. See it if you can, it's a solid film.

Author: 9 May 2020
Review_Url: I watched this movie during Christmas two years ago (2018).

Author: 27 February 2019
Review: One of the most movies ever
Review_Url:
This fim i highly recommended it
actually this movie tought me something & i guess you will figure it out once you watch it
I really loved it

Author: 29 May 2019
Review_Url: I have had this movie for sometime and I had felt reluctant to watch it seeing that it was just gonna be all talk and little drama or action. But I decided to watch it and ooooh my goodness, best thing that ever happened to cinema. Green Book is an amazing movie. The script was so well done, I don't know if it's because it takes most of it's scenes from a true story or cause the writers knew what they were about. Both actors, Mahershala Ali and Viggo Mortensen did exceptionally well. And I have to give it up for Viggo. I haven't really seen him do any mega project since the Lord of the Rings, so watching him play this Italian ruffian was a delight and an eye opener. The entire movie was well done. The directing impeccable. I loved the pace, the cinematography, the highs and lows and man, there couldn't have been a better ending to this great friendship. It surely deserves all the awards it decieved thus far. Great job to the team.

Author: 30 May 2019
Review_Url: I mean this film is a masterpiece one of the best films of the last 10 years and he deserved to be the best movie in 2018

Author: 13 March 2019
Review_Url: The story catched me from start to end. Acting is amazing, imo deserved best picture.

Author: 3 March 2019
Review: Do yourself a favour and See this GEM
Review_Url: From the man that has given you comedy gold in the past, what a 180 turn. The story inspired by true events (how true is irrelevant) takes you on a heartwarming jouney of friendship and self discovery. Scripted beautifully the rollercoaster of emotion will make you laugh and cry.

Author: 25 July 2020
Review: The Old South, not so long ago
Review_Url: I'd never heard of the Green Book until this film was promoted in 2018. I grew up as son of a judge, who was son of a judge in rural county in NE Arkansas. Arkansas roots going back to 1873. My first short story focused on young man running away, knowing that he'd be hanged for rape that he hadn't done. Black. I know racism well both in The South and elsewhere as well. This film is perfect in every way. It offers info and insight through magnificent writing, production, direction, and acting focused on layered characters and story. Couldn't be betta'. Betta' 'n butta'. I luvit' I do. Author J.P. Cunningham

Author: 26 February 2022
Review_Url: Green Book. Tony, who am I then? One of the few films for me that really touched me emotionally. A movie about which you want to say a lot, but you can't put all your thoughts together. The duet of the main characters looks great, their conversations and even how they are silent. Throw in an amazing road trip story, and you have the 2019 Oscar winner.

Author: 18 February 2019
Review_Url:
As soon as I finished this movie, I claimed to my family members that this movie will win Oscars in the Best Picture category.
Perfect performances by Viggo and Mahershala Ali.
This film has shown two main points that how whites are behaving with colored from South to North and 2nd the understanding of human physchology by the lead cast.
The music of this movie was also very good specially the final performance by Dr.Shirley.
Mahershala is giving the best in every other movie.This would be his one of the best . Viggo was so perfect that I did doubt that how he differently performed in LOTR.
A must watch movie for whole family member.
At the end , my message for viewers, spread love not hatred.

Author: 1 April 2020
Review: Green Book becomes more and more like that warm spring, with snow and snow.
Review_Url: The most basic ability of the "Green Book" is to show a fun journey between two people, and it is meaningful.

Author: 22 March 2022
Review: One of the best in a long time !
Review_Url: No adjective is emphatic enough to express my feelings on this superb film. It's about friendship between an educated black man and a streetwise man white man. Good music is a bonus.

Author: 3 September 2021
Review_Url: Again, its full of lgbt agenda and has lots of liberal propaganda crap. Skip this one.

Author: 24 February 2019
Review_Url: Green Book successfully carries out the most sublime function of cinema, which is to put a reality under the screen, in order that such a premise changes or expands the observer's circumstances, placing it in a new perspective. Therefore, the long is a work that should be appreciated by all because of its subtlety and importance placed through art.

Author: 14 December 2018
Review: So glad I went to see this!
Review_Url: What a fantastic movie! Warm, heartfelt, moving and funny - Mortensen is almost unrecognisable and he absolutely nails the character... flaws and all, and Ali (who I only recall seeing in Luke Cage previously) gives us a stand out performance and I'm hoping to see him more in the future! The film balances a difficult subject with such warmth, sincerity and depth of characters, it made me believe the relationships and feel for the characters, it made me laugh (surprisingly frequently!) but also cry... go see it!

Author: 2 February 2019
Review: ONE OF THE BEST MOVIES I HAVE EVER SEEN.
Review_Url: I did not want this movie to end. I can't say enough good things about it! I laughed, I cried, and I wanted to see it again as soon as it ended. You should not miss this one... trust me!

Author: 9 January 2019
Review: Driving Miss Daisy with a slightly different prespective
Review_Url: Of course, it is a good movie embracing beautiful music, good imagery, good acting, etc. But it is still a slow-running road movie whose storyline can be expected well from the beginning.

Author: 16 February 2019
Review_Url: Definitely deserve my 9-star evaluation for the inspiring story and exquisite acting.

Author: 11 March 2019
Review_Url: I don't understand why people are complaining about predictability. When you see a movie which is based on a true story, you have to make yourself ready for that then see it. You need to focus on the "Film" here.

Author: 24 January 2019
Review_Url: Is no one giving to mention the shameless product placement? Not satisfied by simply showing the KFC bucket, lines were written extolling the virtues of this 'artery clogging' foodstuff.

Author: 4 February 2019

Author: 16 May 2020
Review_Url:
This film is one of the best I watched last time. Firstly, the plot is perfect, for the first view ot seems very simple: road-movie in 60s in USA, but it has deeper meaning. It shown social problems of this times, and that problems touched different people despite of their skin colour. The story makes me laugh, be angry, be serious and cry. Secondly, duet of main characters is the brilliant of film. I think Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali played their best roles for nowadays. They played two very different people from different parts of society but they understand each other during the film.
So, it's one the best film of last decade and it really deserved Oscar.

Author: 25 February 2019
Review_Url:
Recently my father asked me "is this film about some book that is also green?". I replied with a smile, "Not exactly, dad."
The book, of course, is present in the film and plays an important role (this is a collection of hotels and restaurants names where African-American travelers could stop), but the story revolves around two characters - a talented African-American pianist (Mahershala Ali) and his Italian-American bouncer driver (Viggo Mortenesen), who travel together around the states where one main character is supposed to give concerts and the second one monitors the safety of his boss.
I really liked the atmosphere of the 60s, clothes, cars, music, characters in the film. The dialogues are written ironically and at the same time filled with meaning for the viewer.
The film that you watch without stopping, although it is far from a blockbuster; the film, where behind a light comedy lies a deep meaning. The green book isn't a picture of slavery, although the theme of "racism" is acutely felt here. This is a film about honesty, humanity, true friendship and mutual help between people.

Author: 14 March 2019
Review: Without a Doubt, this Deserved the Best Picture Oscar Award

Author: 30 April 2020
Review_Url: The great thing about this movie is that the script is solid, and it is very outstanding in characterization and details. This journey south all the way will not allow Dr. Don Shirley to prove his status in the hearts of white people. He is lonely and no one can help him unless he reconciles with himself to complete a self about himself. Redemption. It does not deliberately teach anything, but everyone can see the encounters of certain groups in different times, not just blacks and whites. The theme of this movie is as the finishing line in the film says, because genius is not enough, only courage can change people's hearts, and this is a movie about courage and change. Although it 's a very routine road movie, it 's very warm.

Author: 31 December 2020
Review_Url: Feel good and glosses over deeper topics usually for more light hearted moments. Exploring those deeper topics would give the film a lot more payoff. Well acted. Script and screenplay are executed well. Good pace. Solid direction.

Author: 26 February 2019
Review: Worthy of it's Best Picture Award
Review_Url: Green Book is the greatest film to hit theaters in 2018, period. From the excellent performances of Mahershala Ali and Viggo Morrison to the witty and hilarious dialogue of Nick Vallelonga and Peter Farrely, Green Book will not disappoint. At it's core is an archetypal journey about friendship, love, and understanding. Instead of just a surface level story, Green Book has the rare ability to go below the surface with a cleverly hidden hero's journey and a role reversal that sets it apart from most movies on the subject of race. Rather than a typical "white hero" storyline, Green Book surpasses race altogether, putting forth a narrative of understanding and an exceptional comment on the human condition.

Author: 22 May 2020
Review_Url: What a beautifully directed and produced film celebrating the culmination of two races and backgrounds in a time when it was unthinkable. It's exceptional people like these that we have to thank for a (largely) pro-anti-cultural community now. People who fought back against the ignorance society had created based on a persons skin colour. Odd to imagine what that world was like and although a minority will always continue to push their ignorance forwards, the majority of society nowadays know better thank god. God bless both their souls. Very good watch and very entertaining. One of the best films I've watched in a while.

Author: 4 February 2019
Review_Url: This is one of those movies that no-one wants to leave when the credits roll round. Based on a true story it plots the unfolding of an unlikely friendship between diamond in the rough Bronx-born Italian Tony Lip (Viggo Mortensen) and Dr Don Shirley (Mahershala Ali). Shirley is a concert pianist who needs a driver and some protective muscle as he tours the prejudiced South during the early 60's. Shirley is too cultured to fit in with his own race but too black to fit in with the white one. His internal conflict, Tony's external one as a coloured man's minder, and the friendship that develops make for riveting cinema. There is drama, hilarity, education and pathos in this wonderful movie. A masterpiece.

Author: 4 March 2019
Review: Easy to see why this won Best Picture

Truly great.

Author: 20 December 2020
Review_Url: This film starts out somewhat slow but really shines when it develops its characters so well and introduces you to such a interesting duo and story. The white chauffeur is mafia esk, rough and almost pigish with food. Whilst the black famous pianist is extremely posh and professional which makes for a hilarious and fun Rollercoaster of a relationship. The story is sad but wholesome as its set in a time of huge segregation and racism but the chauffeur sticks up for him along the way. Overall a very sweet film with great acting, story and characterization. If your into your emotional films this is definitely one to watch!

Author: 26 February 2019
Review_Url: It's a handsomely made and watchable picture and there is a real warmth in Ali and Mortensen's great performances. I am not sure if deserved a nomination for Best Film but it's two actors undoubtedly deserved it. The magic of screen chemistry is once again showcased as Ali and Mortensen bring out the best in each other and their respective characters. It is a film with a solid script and a must see this year. It has a warm, congenially progressive vibe and a wonderfully street line of humor. It is both a joyous and sorrowful film, capturing the sense of an unlikely friendship, and the sadness from watching the effects of deeply ingrained racism. "Green Book" has a message that perhaps seems obvious, but is necessary taking into account the time in which we live. nikisreviews.gr

Author: 3 September 2019
Review: A good Hollywood film. Good acting and the camera work as a foundation
Review_Url: I was impressed by both Mortensen and Ali, and the story is alright. Camera work; more than solid, and it's like the 'best butter' you can find in an Old Hollywood type of way. However... my main complaint is a focus on dialogue scenes, particularly with the Lip's (Mortensen's) wife, played by Cardelini, that just drove a point home... too cute? I don't know, but these 'golden'-type moments in a 'golden'-type movie, just detracted from it all, from what I like, completely.

Author: 26 May 2019
Review_Url: We loved Green Book along with the sold-out crowd who applauded loudly at the end. Based on true story of piano virtuoso, Don Shirley's road trip through the south during the 60's, the film pays tribute to his genius and courage as a black man who tries hard to soar above the ugliness of the times. The elegant trappings of his home and his success as a concert pianist leave him arrogantly cold and lonely, but his life begins to change when he hires Tony as his road trip driver. With a history as nightclub bouncer with Mafia connections in New York, Tony is the antithesis of Don's perfection and their evolving relationship on the road makes the movie soar above the ordinary and become magical. Viggo and Ali in the main roles are remarkable, and it's funny and endearing to watch them discard stereotypes and discover their mutual humanity. What we liked best is the movie teaches without preaching, it all unfolds through a myriad of natural moments between two great actors and a strong supporting cast. Top all this off with a really good soundtrack, excellent direction and production values, and an audience that laughed out loud and vigorously applauded at the end...this one is a true 10!

Author: 7 January 2019
Review: Incredibly well done with a blend of humor
Review_Url: Good review of the many types of racism of the 50's and 60's. Cleverly done by wrapping it together with a great story line. No wasted scenes. Moves along and makes many points.

Author: 25 May 2019
Review: Great, but I have seen it before...
Review_Url: I liked Green Book a lot, it is clearly well made and I had a good time watching it. But I felt I've watched this before because it has far too many similarities with "The Untouchables", a French film from 2011 that I loved. It is simply the same story but in a different context: two men from opposites worlds that meet each other because of working motivations, that become friends enriching themselves and growing through the film. Also the alternation between the humor and some touching moment is very similar between the two movies. The fact that "The Untouchables" was so surprising and great at the time is a clue that even this "younger cousin" will be that for the ones who will watch it for the first time. But if you watched both you will probably feel like "I've already seen it" at the end of it.

Author: 25 January 2021
Review_Url:
Yep i see what they wanted to do with this real life story , but is it really Oscar material ? No.. but it fits perfectly into todays liberal agenda and reversed racism, where white people are dumb and black people are always right, always better.. Forcing this agenda into almost every second movie is you know ... bad...
Mahershala Ali is great actor , i loved him in Predators and here as well.. I liked Viggo as well .. The real life story is nice , true friendship build up from the scracth is always something you can get hope from in these days.. But i missed key scenes between those two where the friendship was building.. I mean, i wouldnt want the truth being bended only for movie plot but some key scene should have been more powerful , more philosophical , more opinion vs opinion... 95% of this movie is just banter...

Author: 23 February 2019
Review: Let's you chuckle about a rough subject and time
Review_Url: I went to the theater thinking this was fiction. Wrong. It's a darn good film with superb acting by Viggo Mortenson (Tony Lip) and Mahershala Ali (Dr. Don Shirley). The interplay between the obnxious Italian bouncer (Tony Lip) and the stuffy black vitruoso brought chuckles, was thought provoking, and didn't just demonize the white guy. It showed both men's humanity and obvious flaws, and if it didn't make racism/segregation seem horrid, it didn't make it look nice. After playing to standing ovations, the good doctor still had to use the outhouse and drive to the colored cafe to eat.

Author: 23 July 2019
Review_Url: This Emotional and very enjoyable journey you are taken on, between the relationship of an Italian American and African American at the time of harsh segregation In the deep south. Played impeccably by Marheshala ali as the eccentric pianist extraordinaire(don Shirley) and Vigo morgentson as his Italian big hearted driver(tony lip)whilst watching thier relationship become a thing of magic from the rough to the heartwamring and too add it's based in a true story..A solid 10/10 and the best film I've seen in many years.

Review_Url: At first glance this movie reminded me of the French movie: "The Intouchables". A solid movie through and through and I highly recommend you go see if if you haven't already. Although the undertone of this one is a little darker. It perferctly displays how humanity has evolved since the 60's, and they somehow made it work with a PG-13 rating. Viggo Mortensen gave a stunning performance as the loud-mouth Italian American and Mahershala Ali as the cultured and well mannared African American ( For which he won the oscar ). I am a little insulted that Viggo wasn't nominated in any categories but hey... The chemistry between the two main characters was awesome! Goes to show that opposites does attract.

Review_Url: Just go and watch this movie. You will not regret it.

Author: 29 November 2018
Review_Url:
I saw Green Book today and was thoroughly entertained. The outcome is predictable, but the journey getting there is heartfelt. It is by turns dramatic, funny, touching and scary - as in how people were treated in the south in 1962. Last time I saw the horror of it on screen was in The Help.
Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali both give award worthy performances. In fact, I read that Viggo won best actor, and the movie was named best picture by National Board of Review.
It is a riveting portrait of how two disparate men found a bond that lasted a lifetime.
And the fact that this is based on a true story makes it all the more poignant.

Author: 21 June 2019
Review_Url: Based on a true story, this film was emotional and heartfelt. It made you feel happy and yet sad, it made you laugh one moment and hold back tears in the next. This film was beautifully made and it really makes you think about racism and how awful things were for black people back in the day. It almost makes you feel ashamed as a white person, but then you look at the two protagonists and see that actually even in those days it was possible for true friendships to be had between white and black people. It is a brilliant film and you'd be stupid to miss it.

Author: 3 March 2019
Review: One of the Best Films of 2018
Review_Url: Green Book is directed by Peter Farrelly and tells the true story of Tony Vallelonga, played by Viggo Mortensen, an Italian-American bouncer who becomes a driver and bodyguard for Don Shirley, played by Mahershala Ali, which was set in 1962.

Author: 19 March 2019
Review_Url:
Going to keep this one short:
Green book is a lovely story of two men crossing state and personal borders and become friends. It's a story about racisme in a period of segregation, but it's told like a roadtrip movie. It has drama, it has laughs (mainly thanks to Vigo's character) and a pretty good story. Only critique that can be given is that the movie sometimes feels a bit to safe. But in the end a splendid movie.

Author: 21 February 2019
Review: I am a white male and I would honor any other race the same.
Review_Url: What a great movie to see and think about. I do honor the courage the movie industry takes and it is also taking some responsibility for showing our USA past, embarrassing as I see it but truth is one to learn from and become better. The movie is not flashy and not one with lots of special effects, etc. Its a story. I also work with many races at work and I don't think I would ever judge another by their color as ability is what matters when you try to save a life at the hospital. This movie helps me understand what a few percent of out humanity feels and acts on. I mean it is very hard for me to see how others could do what they do, more like unreal, and that is not confronting reality either. See it on the screen or at home with another. Good for the soul, pun intended or not.

Author: 12 March 2019
Review_Url: What is perhaps the most telling exchange in this ode to some mystical, post-racial looking back, boy to man story is that of the Kentucky fried chicken dialogue. When Tony consternates that he is "more black" than Don Shirley simply because he eats fried chicken and listens to Aretha Franklin, one can only pause at the absurdity of such an utterance from a presumed first generation Italian American to a African American man presumedly steeped in the 1950s Black Liberation movement. One would have expected Mr. Shirley to take a bat to the back of Tony's head with such a disparaged and, most certainly, historically inaccurate, depiction of American society pre-Civil Rights legislation, Pre-Voting Rights legislation, and at the cusp of a radical consciousness of Black identity still forming its sensibilities for the late-20th C. Placed in the context of American Southern apartheid, with a heap of hand waving by their Northern white countrymen, to suggest a white man of any ethnicity would gladly identify as more black than a African American man in the midst of one of the violent and consequential turning points in American history is not only ludicrous but offensive. The very script contradicts itself when later Tony assaults a police man in Alabama who assailed him with an epithet that for Mr. Shirley was par for the course. If this film is allegory of where we were a half century ago and all we have to look forward to now that we have freed ourselves from America's original sin, one can only contemplate how poorly we understand our own history and our inability to reckon with the utter failure of spirit that is American racism.

Author: 28 February 2019
Review: Uplifting, but an insult to Italian Americans
Review_Url: This movie was uplifting. It was based on the association/friendship between two men, but it is, for the most part, fiction. It is only loosely based on truth. To please Hollywood, they put in the part about Don Shirley being caught having sex with another man at a YMCA. According to what I have read, this never happened. It surprises me that Hollywood is so concerned about furthering the cause of the LGBT community, and about paying homage to the plight of African Americans in this country, yet they give the Academy Award to a film that portrays an Italian American man in the worst light. This film plays off a stereotype that insults the intelligence. This movie portrays Frank Anthony Vallelonga as a total idiot. That he wasn't. He was a very intelligent actor. If he were alive today, I am sure that he would object to his name being placed on this character in the film. I am sure that Don Shirley would object to the way his character is portrayed, as well.

Author: 29 January 2019
Review: A remarkable film that tells an unbelievable story of friendship.
Review_Url: Green Book tells the story of night club bouncer Tony 'lip' Vallelonga, who becomes the driver of African american pianist Dr Don Shirley. The movie is remarkable in its portrayal of two men both dealing with the own problems, with perfect examples of classic 1960's racism which is dealt heavily in the film. Viggo Mortensen gives an absolute stunning performance as an Italian american man. Mahershala Ali creates an almost magical performance with his character. It is with these two actors and there chemistry on screen together that creates a fantastic film. Green Book is by far one of the best movies of the year, and I am so glad to have gone and seen this.

Author: 6 March 2021
Review_Url:
Stylish film which portrays the changing, contradictory relationship between an Italian working-class immigrant and an African-American elitist.
The roles are reversed as Tony has a hardened working-class, socially tough outlook on life, even although he is racist. Dr Shirley is cocooned within his privileged, classical musical position although he harbours deeply held principled views as the victim of racial abuse.
The film is set in the sixties and the question is, how different are things now?

Author: 31 May 2023
Review_Url: Green Book more than deserves all the superlative comments it receives. It also deserved the Oscar it won for Best Picture, but Viggo Mortensen should have won as well! His character shines and resonates as the sweet, beefy, endearing daddy that everyone wishes they had. I fell in love (and lust) with his character and wanted him to bounce me on his knee. It was also refreshing to see a gay black character with class, dignity, and polish, which the late Don Shirley certainly possessed. Green Book captures the times perfectly, but where attitudes are concerned, not that much has really changed in the last 60 years, especially in Deliverance country, the land of the inbred hillbilly where an orange loser is worshipped.

Author: 5 April 2019
Review: Heartwarming and Funny. Could have ended half hour ago ...
Review_Url: The only reason I don't rate this movie higher is only because it had 4-5 beautiful places to end having made its point yet stayed real to the 50's ... stayed real to the reality of today. We know both characters evolve. That's not giving anything away. And they do it brilliantly. They're are breakthroughs near the end that suffice for an appropriate ending but instead of knowing when to end it, got Disney-like. That didn't ruin anything. I loved the message and the movie. But someone might have left the mystery of a country on its slow journey to decency. That would have maintained the lump in my throat. It was still worth seeing.

And here is Vigo ... one of the best actors in in the film industry... he, who adds another memorable character to his portfolio.

Author: 19 January 2022
Review_Url: I saw Don Shirley speak in college in 1966. At the time, I just thought he was a damn good pianist, using bass and cello to create a unique sound. And when this film came out, I thought: "I saw this guy!". I know the critics are harsh on this film, but I sat there for two hours, completely engrossed. I know there are stereotypes. Maybe it's because repetitive anti-minority and racist actions have become so commonplace that they seem like stereotypes. I believe that the performance was made by these two wonderful actors. There is a subtlety to this film that surpasses many other films of this type. Yes, there are southern cops here; yes, there are men's toilets that are prohibited; yes, there are simplistic views on the racism of white New Yorkers. But what I got was a realistic representation of a developing friendship. Shirley is blunt and self-absorbed; Lip doesn't understand anything most of the time. And I believed in them. Watch this movie.

Author: 23 March 2019
Review_Url:
This is a classic film already. Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali worked this "odd couple" to perfection actually defining how the development of deep lifelong friendship is derived. Having seen the film tonight for the first time after hearing all the Oscar talk, it strikes me profoundly that the best supporting actor role was undeniably dependent on the nominee for best leading actor in this film. I think that both actors deserved Oscars, but not one. That is to say it should have been both or neither as the only choice. I don't get the academy's ambivalence, since they awarded best picture for the film. (Yes, I have seen Bohemian Rhapsody and loved the film and Rami Malek's performance.)
This was a beautiful and moving film mainly due to the chemistry between the two men.

Author: 23 November 2019
Review_Url:
When I've heard about this movie, I thought "oh boy.. here is another 'white vs. colored' movie", but boy I was wrong !!
This movie is a real joy, and a breeze of fresh air compared to other movies that addressed this subject.
To take an Italian 'white supremacy' type of guy, and put him with a very gifted 'but black' artist, and make him understand the crime of racial behavior while showing him the other side of...well...everything... while taking us on this trip with them - was a wonderful idea and that's what makes this movie so good !!
I recommend this movie to everyone, it's a must see and of very high quality in all aspects !

Author: 21 April 2019
Review: Dear Critics Of This Motion Picture
Review_Url: Green Book is an absolutely beautiful film. It shows tolerance, acceptance and friendship, against all odds, despite all the arguing the main characters are doing. The purest kind of friendship, the unconditional, natural and semi-confrontational. Tony and Don's friendship happens purely out of circumstance, the fact that they are driving many miles on the road together, from state to state. I have heard that this film has gotten a lot of critique, and I'm not sure why. I presume people think it overshadows the deep problems of segregation by having it be a signle man, a musician, who is less affected than most other African-Americans in the deep south at the time. Frankly, I disagree with this complaint. The Jim Crow days of US History spanned not one, but TWO decades, and were wildly complex, I mean, if it wasn't, JFK would have been able to do a lot more than he did. And that's why I don't blame him, nor do I blame this movie. It's impossible to make a heartfelt movie about race and not miss details some people find crucial. I think, to truly enjoy movies like this, one shouldn't nitpick these films, but look at it in regards to the big picture. This movie is instrumental in bringing awareness, as there very well might be people who think like Tony, narrow-minded, but not with the intention of supressing or hurting non-whites. Simply because they don't quite get it. Here, one can get educated through seeing Tony taught lessons as well. All in all, this a wonderful, family friendly, hilarious film with huge societal impact. Recommended for everyone.

Author: 26 February 2019
Review_Url: First of all let me say there is very little wrong with this film. It's true rating is about a 9/10 but it's underrated atm so I've given it a 10 for now. Author: 13 January 2019
Review: A True Gift to an Audience
Review_Url: Green Book is based upon a true story, and one that's important for most people to view. It's regarding race relations the history of discrimination purely based upon a person's color, and not their contributions to their own community, but to society as a whole. This film was beautifully written, directed, and acted. And while I was able to laugh in parts, I found it more drama than comedy. I strongly encourage more people to view this to fully comprehend what our past has allowed white people to do to those who aren't the same race or ethnicity.

Review_Url:

Perfect blend of emotion and humour with great acting from Viggo and Ali, Viggo Mortensen's character is portrayed brilliantly in his over the top display.

Review_Url:
This movie was so shocking but historically and tragically realistic. During a period in our lives when there is so much hate being perpetuated, this movie is a great eye opener as to a very brief glimpse of the way African Americans were being treated in the eastern -midwest and South in particular.
I highly recommend this film. It is both heart warming and shocking. Don't want to spoil any of the movie for anyone.
Dr. Don Shirley was an Amazing Virtuoso. Born with a Savant talent for piano that only others could wish for. Mahershala Ali's acting and piano playing were remarkable. A must go see. Bring your teenagers. Its a great history lesson and great eye opener.

Author: 15 February 2019
Review_Url: 'Green Book' is charming, funny and heart warming. Oh, and "based" on a true story. "Inspired" may have been an even better choice. So if your looking for historical accuracy, you may want to pass. However, taken for what it is, a road trip movie about two diametrically opposed characters directed by Peter Farrelly, it's a fun and thoughful story. It's flawed only by its inability to decide if it is about the characters or investigating a bigger idea about race then and now. There is no question that this subject, especially in these times, deserves better and more serious consideration but does every movie about race in America have to be charged with that duty? (This may be the fault of sloppy marketing that leaned into the "based on a true story" trailer plug. ) Having said that, there is a lot to unpack here and the movie gets bogged down in too many running themes. (Thus a 7 over an 8 rating) Mortensen and Ali have a nice chemistry. It'd be cool if they did something else together. To coin another movie, "This might be the making of a beautiful friendship.".

Author: 18 March 2023
Review_Url: The story of the film lives in the sixties, in an era when racism was widespread between black people and white people. In the story, we see that a black person makes a white person a driver for him, while the driver faces a problem with black people. We see their journey together, and we see the types of racism and injustice that black people lived through. And its harm to them at that time. The film was one of the best films of 2018, not only because of the story, but in many aspects, including the acting performance, which was very wonderful and was able to make the feelings reach me. And the journey of our main character and the change that occurred in him after he saw racism and its harm and injustice to which black people are subjected. It was not only a story of struggle, but also an emotional story. The film had a goal and it achieved this goal in all aspects. They are all the same and not different and each person represents himself. The movie was really great. It made me smile at times and made me angry at times. A beautiful and moving story. The movie deserves the rating 10/10.

Author: 7 February 2019
Review_Url: I was pleasantly surprised by this film... and I cried. I already knew both these actors are very talented but holy WOW they blew me away in this. Their chemistry is so good and I hope they both win their Oscars. I really hated Viggo's character Tony at first but he redeemed himself by the end, and what a positive message to send: fight hate and prejudice with love and loyalty. Tony became loyal to this man because of experiences he never realized could affect him. His face when he hears Doc play for the first time... priceless. He decides to respect his friend's humanity first and foremost because we ALL have a choice to be decent human beings. It's a really wonderful change for anyone to make. I can't wait to purchase this movie and watch it again!

Author: 25 November 2018
Review_Url: There are seldom any movies released today that compare with Green Book. This is a well written and acted film that spans comedy and pathos. The performances by both Mahershala Ali and Viggo Mortensen are award worthy. The filming in period locations using vintage cars and fashions was outstanding. The story of the seedy "colored only" hotels and the overt apartheid of the deep South of the early 60s was revealed through the eyes and feelings of the pompous but educated and musically talented black man and his white Bronx-raised chauffeur. Both characters took a journey together for two months on the tour-stop road and learned great lessons about each other. There were powerful scenes throughout the film that left one amused and uneasy. Nevertheless, this was a completely unexpected treat and one that I would heartily recommend.

Author: 28 December 2018
Review_Url:
This is my first review posted on IMDB however I feel compelled to write a review because I loved this film so much.
Warning to bigots: you may not enjoy this film. Thankfully we don't live in the 60's any more where the vast majority of people (mostly in the South) were staunch bigots, however unfortunately there are still enough bigots out there. That's why films like this are so important to make and watch. Granted, the bigots who should watch it the most won't, but the rest of us can enjoy our evolution as human beings.
My words may seem harsh, however the film confronts racism and bigotry in its ludicrous entirety. No need to get into the plot; that should be covered extensively by the plot synopsis. Suffice it to say the walls of race are broken down unexpectedly and the result is a beautiful display of humanity when things go right (that is to say when race is trumped by dignity).
The acting is superb. This film gets 9 out of 10 because I don't feel it's the best film I've ever seen, which I think should be reserved for a perfect 10, although it is damn close. There's a lot of great movies out there and this may not be the best of all time but is absolutely fantastic.

Author: 16 February 2019
Review_Url: I saw this movie recently and liked it a lot - perhaps you will too. I think it effectively covered a period in our history as a country that was not the best. Nevertheless, it did so with unexpected and unusual insight, humor, tenderness and the birth of a friendship between two men that seems highly unlikely but beautiful in the end.

Author: 3 January 2019
Review_Url:
Green Book is a road story, telling the relationship between a racist Italian-American bodyguard and his boss who is a famous black piano player.
Viggo Mortensen who is playing Tony Lip, the Italian bodyguard, shines as a leading actor. Tony Lip is an uneducated but a practical person. He can even eat 26 hot dogs for money or steal the gangster's precious hat and sell back to the gangster again. We see his racism in the scene he puts the glasses which black workers drank lemonade, to the garbage. He became unemployed when Copa, the nightclub he works, closed for renovation.
At that time the famous piano player Dr. Shirley (played by Academy Award winner Mahershala Ali) was looking for a driver for his tour to the southern cities of USA. He needed not only a driver, but a practical man getting things done in the tour program. He was well educated, can speak at least 3 languages, but his social skills is not well developed. He hires Tony Lip and the the tour begins.
We know the director Peter Farrelly and his brother from absurd comedies like The Dumb and The Dumber or There's Something About Mary. Even though there are many scenes that we have laughed in Green Book, we cannot say that is a comedy. Peter Farrelly made a good job with blending comedy, dram, road movie and even romance.
As a summary Green Book is a very good film with solid performances. You will enjoy every minute of this 130 minutes film. One more note, the film was based on a true story. After watching the film, find some Don Shirley music from Spotify or whatever, and listen him and his trio with a glass of whiskey.

Author: 9 February 2019
Review_Url: This movie details the relationship between pianist Don Shirley (Mahershala Ali) and a bouncer named Tony (Viggo Mortensen) who is hired to drive him through the Deep South in 1962 for a two month concert tour. He is to make sure he reaches all the concert destinations and to keep him safe if any trouble should arise, and plenty does. The acting is wonderful, especially by Viggo Mortensen, who portrays an Italian from New York who is a bit rough around the edges compared to the dignified Shirley. Plenty of humor is interspersed within the poignant relationship that develops between the two men. This movie is based on a true story when segregation was the "norm", and the Green Book was a travel guide for African Americans that listed hotels that were available for them to stay in, which were often subpar if best. If you are looking for a fast paced thriller, this movie might not be for you, but if you like movies that show a piece of history and true to life heart-warming stories, then this one is for you!

Review_Url: In the 91st Oscar Award Nominated for best Picture and also for Best Film Editing Green Book is my movie of the year 2018 ,its enjoy-ability comes almost completely from its starring performances from an excellent Viggo Mortensen which is my most favorite actor & also nominated for best Leading Roll and Mahershala Ali for the best supporting roll both are imbue their roles with precision and pathos. Author: 9 May 2019
Review: Feel good movie about race relations
Review_Url: The title refers to a travel guide used by African-Americans during the time of segregation to find safe, friendly hotels and restaurants from 1937 to 1966. In 1962, African-American pianist Don Shirley (Mahershala Ali) employed Frank Vallelonga, aka "Tony Lip" (Viggo Mortensen) to be his driver and bodyguard when his trio, which included George (Mike Hatton) on the upright bass and Oleg (Dimiter D. Marinov) on the cello, toured the American Midwest and South. Shirley suffers many indignities, and, to a certain extent, Tony can shield him. For example, the trio is employed at a country club in Alabama, but Shirley cannot eat in its restaurant so he and Tony find a BBQ restaurant down the road. Other complications are that Shirley is gay and an alcoholic. The two men bond, of course. One of the funnier scenes takes place when Tony serves Shirley friend chicken without utensils, which Shirley initially refuses because he is a fastidious eater. Overall, this is the feel-good movie of the year, although predictable and rather old-fashioned, and the two leads are excellent with able support by Linda Cardellini as Dolores, Tony's wife. One reviewer described the movie as "The Odd Couple" meets "Driving Miss Daisy". It was based on a true story, and Tony's son Nick co-wrote the screenplay, which won the Oscar in the Original Screenplay category. Unfortunately, it has been a controversial winner of the Academy Award for Best Picture, because many people felt that it oversimplified race relations in the United States and members of Shirley's family have objected to his portrayal.

Author: 1 January 2019
Review_Url: This film takes place in the 1960's. It examines the controversy of Black discrimination in a very unique way. Vigo Mortensen plays "Tonylip". A tough and rough bouncer at the Copa in New York city. He takes a temporary job as a bodyguard / driver for an up and coming concert pianist as he embarks on a tour of the deep south. Needless to say these two individuals could not be more different having come from two contrasting worlds. Thrown together they learn to appreciate one another and the life lessons each brings to eachother. There re more than a few laughs and many moments to ponder and reflect. All in all I highly recommend this film as something of substance. Excellently written and cast, a very good watch . PS the very last line of the movie made me laugh at myself. Tony's wife thanks Dr. Shirley for helping Tony with the "Lettuce " ( cash income). It took a few seconds to dawn on me she was saying " Letters" with a bronx accent .

Author: 15 February 2019
Review_Url: This film is such a surprise for me. After watching Blakkklansman I was expecting similar propaganda in this movie, but that's not the case. It is tasteful and touching depiction of the friendship between two people that are more similar than they think in such specific time period.

Author: 12 April 2020
Review: Very good. The story is sweet and ironic.
Review_Url:
Very good. The story is sweet and ironic.
With racial discrimination as the theme, the traveling performance reflects that no matter how famous black people are, they are not free from unequal treatment.
The protagonist also goes from initially discriminating against blacks to accepting and treating blacks with equal respect.
Overall, the movie is true, ironic and positive!

Author: 28 February 2019
Review: A movie that hits every note right
Review_Url: I am gonna be short and sweet here. This is a fantastic film especially in today's context where people are using race bait to profit themselves. No doubt the academy got right with this one. The two leads are absolutely amazing in their roles where they perfectly complement the story playing a opposing nature to one another, every side characters are there to move the story forward and not just shoehorned. Editing is breathtakingly beautiful, script holds perfectly tightly til the very end(even when the credits role), cinematography is top notch, music fits the tone of the film very neatly. I tried real hard to nitpick few flaws with this one but its just not there. This is a great hybrid of road trip comedy and biographic drama. Applause yourselves whoever have been involved with this gem because this is how you use real race issue and its history in a film.

Author: 22 February 2019
Review_Url: High praise for the performers (side note: Viggo Mortensen, a superior actor, may be endangering his health in cutting or putting on weight in various roles) and the director. To people who don't like "Green Book": it's a movie, and a story can be entertaining and meaningful without being a lecture. Two quick points: a. I'd vote for Mahershala Ali to win the Best Supporting Actor Oscar -- superior work in developing a complicated character -- gifted, eccentric, idealistic, ambivalent -- and for ultimately being successful in creating pathos and admiration for the character in the audience. b. To highlight one of many excellent scenes (you'll know when you see the film): one of the best ways to fight racism is for the decent person in the room to have the guts not to deliver a sermon but to just tell the fool in the room to knock it off and to damn well watch-your-rear mean it.

Author: 4 September 2021
Review: Superb film - will become one of my favourites
Review_Url: This tale of a NY Italian hired to drive a black concert pianist to various venues through the Deep South is a fictionalised version of a true story - and it could not have been better played nor better cast. What a terrible shame for Viggo Mortensen that he was faced with Rami Malek's stellar performance as Freddie Mercury at the Oscars in 2019 (for 2018), otherwise he surely would have won. This delightfully told but disturbing film makes the viewer's skin crawl at the inexpressibly inhuman attitudes of the White residents of the Deep South - how could anything so intolerable have existed in living memory?

Author: 22 April 2019
Review: Mortensen and Ali at the top of their game!
Review_Url: Green Book is one of the best road movies in a long while. We have seen a lot of films that deal with "the Afro-American experience" in the last decade, some of which have been highlighted by various awards. But Green Book goes beyond them, because it covers the diasporic standpoint not just from an Afro-American perspective, but also suggests that white Americans have a cast system between them as well. As we see in the film, Italian-American, as opposed to Irish-American, British- American or German-American, is the black of the white race. This is where the chemistry between Tony Lip and Doc Shirley is formed; Shirley is a black man who lives by the white standards and cultural values, but as we see later; he has been through a lot, he has experienced what being Afro-American means in this country, although buried deep; he still knows his roots. But he has "whitened" himself to fit the society; and in Tony Lip, he sees himself, and Italian-American, not much different than himself, the only difference is, Tony does not care to hide his true identity and Shirley learns from him throughout the film.

Author: 26 November 2018
Review_Url: "Green Book" relies on its writing and excellent performances by its leads to carry it through. What a concept. Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali absolutely nail the evolution of their relationship as two polar opposites show us how the differences are exactly the same. "Green" is in the dead centre of the spectrum and this film effectively takes you through it. It laughs at stereotypes and deals with shameful things from the past. It reminds us how far things have come and how far they still have to go. It leaves us with a poignant message that It's not about fitting in where you belong but more about belonging where you fit in. Green Book is.both a timely and timeless commentary on the condition of the human condition

Author: 6 December 2018
Review: Stunning story of friendship against he odds
Review_Url:
Saw an advance screening of Green Book at a cineworld secret screening. The theatre was almost full no doubt anticipating Mary Poppins and people actually got up left. To those people I say "more fool you"
This will, I have no doubt become a classic. Two complete opposites thrown together in mutual disdain form a solid bond that lasts a lifetime.
Tears, laughter, mostly at the expense of Tony Lip and his brash, working class attitude to life. Superbly acted Vigo Mortenson was brilliantly believable while Marhershala Ali portrais himself as a self absorbed, holier than thou superior but actually turns out to be equally as flawed as Tony. The KFC scene was brilliantly played as was the scene involving the jade.
Absolutely loved it, as apparently did the rest of the audience who laughed out loud as one. A young guy sat at the side of me said " I wouldn't normally go tho see this kind of film, but I'm glad I did" and so was I
