Author: 14 April 2019
Review_Url: This film has gotten a lot of bad press from the historical inaccuracies to it's controversial win for Best Picture-I have to admit I did buy into some of that press. Despite that however, the audience reaction seemed to be very positive (at least in Japan)-several of my friends recommended the film to me. So, with slightly low expectationsI I finally watched the film last night-it was pretty good. The performances (especially by Viggo Mortensen, Mahershala Ali, and Linda Cardellini) were wonderful, the story was very heartwarming, and the music (both the score and soundtrack) were solid. Was it worth the Best Picture? Not really, far from the best, but I don't think it was an outrageous decision either. One of the controversies was the depiction of race- such example is apparent when Don Shirley, a high-brow black man embraces the low class stereotypes in the latter half of the film. I personally thought it worked in the film because the friendship and trust between the Tony Lip and Don Shirley changed the two men-both embracing something new. It's a typical buddy, road trip movie, not a historical epic like 12 years a slave or The Color Purple. Some critics and haters called this Driving Miss Daisy 2, I completely disagree because it does this film does provide a fresh take (A white working class man chauffeuring a black and gay musician) on the Roadtrip genre. It's worth the watch!

Author: 5 April 2023
Review: Heartwarming Tale of Friendship and Tolerance
Review_Url: "Green Book" is a heartwarming movie that tackles the issue of racism in America during the 1960s. The film features outstanding performances by Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali, who play a working-class Italian-American bouncer and a world-class African American pianist, respectively. The two embark on a journey across the southern United States, using "The Green Book," a guidebook for African American travelers to navigate through segregated areas. The film not only sheds light on the racial divide but also delivers a powerful message of friendship, acceptance, and understanding. Overall, "Green Book" is a must-see movie that leaves a lasting impression.

You will naturally like the characters that are not so well described as real people, and you will laugh at the funny or not so funny bits. Review: That odd movie that lifts the spirit
Review_Url: Once in a while a movie really lifts your spirits, and this is one of them. It's not a feel-good movie, or a crowd pleaser, in my opinion. Although audiences surly was pleased and feeling good after seeing this gem. It's based on a true story, one of the redemption we can achieve if we see another as we truly are, beyond bravado, facade and stereotypes. It's beautiful to watch masterful actors like Ali and Mortensen enact true humanity that transcend surface level contradictions in a hard world where their humanity seems alien to most. My hope to future audiences is that you might let this movie lift you.

Don must cure Tony of his racism and ignorance and Tony's job is to cure Don of his snobbery and emotional frigidity that it goes thoroughly in the right way up to the end of film. In an initial scene, Tony puts a couple of glasses in the bin because his wife has let two black workmen drink out of them. But the level of fanatical racism this implies pretty much vanishes when Tony meets Don. So their road trip to self-discovery begins, and we hold our breath for when the white boy racists inevitably show up, or for when Shirley wishes to use the white bathroom at those grand places where he has been booked to play.
...
I enjoyed it every minute.

Author: 28 November 2019
Review_Url: A delicate and precious film, ruthless towards good feelings but hopeful towards racism that comes from ignorance and not from the heart, when in the end human solidarity is still able to redeem men and their sins. It is a film that perhaps we Europeans cannot fully understand (even if racism begins again to meander dangerously between our feet) but I like to think that the choice of an Italian American of the populace as a counterpart to the cultured afro doctor American is not random. After all, among the many ugly figures that the driver does, in the end he is saved because he truly begins to believe in his neighbor, because in the end he makes himself loved, because he begins to understand and participate in the harshness of the battle, because he contrasts and shares a fundamental value, that of the family, which we once had but which we are losing today. Because it is true that in life you have to be what you are (otherwise you generate monsters) but what sense does it have if to crown a successful life, on Christmas Eve we find ourselves alone or worse on the point of death there was no one to greet us with the serenity of an affectionate embrace? Another element common to films that involve some form of catharsis is that of travel, an ancient metaphor for the path of the soul. I sincerely would have given the Oscar to Viggo Mortensen, more and more an actor of thick cast in roles that makes him look easy but that are not easy. And as the protagonist says, it's really a pleasure to see the landscapes that are the backdrop for this trip.

Review: One of the finest films of 2018 and a good holiday film, too. 10
Review_Url: GREEN BOOK (2018) "A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver of an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South." Author: 7 July 2019
Review: Great movie! (tiny spoiler contained- it doesn't determine the outcome or progress of the plot really though)
Review_Url:
I enjoyed everything about it. The scenario, the characters, filming, directing, everything. The humor was also exceptional. I was absorbed in the movie until the very end.
What's very interesting and special about this film is that it gives a different perspective of racism against Afro-Americans, because it talks about an Afro-American that had a completely different lifestyle. High class, economically successful, always formally dressed, performed music for the Western European people etc. Before watching this movie, I'd rush to the conclusion that he'd be very respected because of his fame and skills, but that was certainly not the case. There was prejudice about him from both sides: light skin colored and dark skin colored people. I had the impression that individuals like Aretha Franklin or Sam Cook wouldn't have to deal with racism that much: but maybe they faced it, just like Don Shirley did. Therefore, this movie presents everything from a very unique angle.
It's a movie I'd definitely recommend, not only for entertainment purposes, but also educational and awareness reasons.

Review_Url: The subtlety in this movie is exceptional - and it has so many layers - family, culture, honesty, dignity, genius, respect, acceptance, racism, music and friendship. The Green Book is a film about honesty, human dignity, true friendship and mutual support between people. Enjoyed it thoroughly.

Author: 10 May 2020
Review_Url: A journey of reawakening in a Country like ours - Gore Vidal called it the United States Of Amnesia - the absurdity of the behavior in the Southern communities even the kindest ones have a jarring effect. Viggo Mortensen is sheer perfection as the all American Italian. The opening of his heart and of his mind is a total joy and Mahershala Ali provides another magnetic character to his already rich list of magnetic characters but what makes this film fly so high is the humanity that Mortensen and Ali infuse their characters with. I loved them and Green Book provided me with one of the most satisfying endings of 2018. It leaves you with the hopeful thought that perhaps we're not there yet but that we are on our way. Happy New Year!

Author: 31 January 2019
Review: Green Book goes the extra mile
Review_Url: This is a hugely enjoyable movie that shows how far race relations in America has come and perhaps also how far it still has to go, told with a good storyline, simple plot device (the road trip) but most of all with really sympathetic lead characters. Two opposites in NY life, Tony Lip, the working class Italian nightclub bouncer from the Bronx ( Viggo Mortensen) and the world class African American pianist Dr Don Shirley ( Mahershala Ali) who lived in a flat above Carnegie Hall, team up for a tour down South. Based on a true story, the road trip shows us that opposite characters can learn humanity and civil understanding of another's world viewpoint from each other in an entertaining and humourous way, and survive the dangers, prejudices and stark reality of life in the Deep South in 1962. Go see it with an open heart and mind and you will be entertained and educated as you enjoy this tale of two men's journey towards mutual understanding.

Author: 16 March 2019
Review: The most beautiful films about racism
Review_Url:
If I was not white enough. If I was not black enough, tell me who I am!.
This sentence that comes in the middle of the film almost embodies the content of the entire film.
I was reluctant to watch this film first, because the American director Peter Farrelly, one of the directors specialized in the manufacture of light comedy. There is an implicit fear of a distinguished director in the humor industry that would be able to make a biographical, dramatic film. But what I saw was truly amazing. Farley has outdone himself here.
For the first time, I see a highly professional film dealing with a recurring issue in American cinema, the issue of racism that America had more than 50 years ago. A very clever dramatic adaptation of the famous pianist Donald Shirley and his relationship with his white driver Tony Lip, who in turn had a somewhat racist view of black, but who, as a result of his need to work, agreed to become a driver for Shirley.
On a long journey towards the southern cities, Shirley plays for the white class, when it feels the importance of its culture when it listens to a genius. the story of the different style begins between the two people in a very sophisticated manner, especially from Mahershala as Shirley.
Interesting dialogues, cultural backgrounds, and dramatic development by influencing the other. Explains the racist concepts of circulation.

Based on a true story, Green Book is moving, funny, thought provoking, and, in the end, a heart warming story of friendship and family-the one you're born with and the one you make along the road.

Review: The beginning of reconciliation of one symbolizes the beginning of countless understanding and reconciliation.

Author: 24 May 2020
Review: Watch a good movie and enjoy life
Review_Url:
Racial conflict is a big and difficult topic. The director's logic is meticulous and clear. There are several clips of restaurants, hotels, concert halls and bathrooms refusing to accept black people. There's a clip of a white driver repairing a car for a black musician, and a group of hard-working black slaves in the nearby field stop to watch them. Another clip is the driver bribes the police to help the black musicians.
These fragments later erupted in a rainy night with black musicians roaring: in their eyes, I am neither white, nor black, nor man, and I do not know who I am! I'll string all the above clips together.

Review_Url: Directed by "Peter Farrelly" who is mostly known for making goofy comedies gives us something completely different. Based on a true story "Viggo Mortensen" and "Mahershala Ali" make it real with "Mortensen" playing "Tony Lip" an Italian American and "Ali" prorating the rich, eccentric pianist/doctor "Don Shirley. The movie takes place in the deep south of America during the 1960s and it's accurately depicted. The two main characters journey from state to state as their unlikely friendship begins to form. The film deals with important subject matter and there's some scenes that truly demonstrate the division between people during that time. The cinematography is great and everything comes together nicely in this film, I highly recommend it!ð

I was lucky to have been able to attend an early screening of this wonderful movie.The Green Book was so shocking but historically and tragically realistic. During a period in our lives when there is so much hate being perpetuated, this movie is a great eye opener. A very brief glimpse of the way African Americans were being treated in the eastern -midwest and South in particular.
I highly recommend this film. It is both heart warming and shocking. Don't want to spoil any of the movie for anyone.
Dr. Don Shirley was an Amazing Virtuoso. Born with a Savant talent for piano that only others could wish for. Mahershala Ali's acting and piano playing were remarkable. A must go see. Bring your teenagers. Its a great history lesson and great eye opener.

Author: 11 April 2020
Review_Url: What Tony and Don think is that "still to Chu and northbound" is not on the same road. On the other hand, because of the fate of the association to become partners and partners. Don is an outsider in the eyes of whites, although he is a pianist, but because of his different complexion, he has never been really treated as a master by whites. In the eyes of blacks, he was also alien, because he lived an elegant life and never lowered his posture, contrary to the black public at that time. In fact, the Don in the lively atmosphere is lonely, he can not really integrate into any race, he is not black, nowhere to go, he is "proud to live" but humble to the dust. Tony- started with the mentality of working and making money, but when he saw what happened to Don, he gradually broke the relationship between employers and servants and extended a helping hand from a friend's point of view. The "toilet incident", "suit incident", "fried chicken incident", "writing love letter incident" in the Green Paper. Let the relationship between Don and Tony constantly change, each collision between the two people is not only a collision of human nature, but also a self-discovery and self-cognition of the protagonist.

Author: 13 May 2020
Review: The beauty inside the play, the noise outside the play
Review_Url: I saw it a long time ago, and some details are not remembered. What impressed me most is that this play shows the social problems that have lasted for a hundred years in a relaxed and humorous way. There is no bitterness, deep hatred, no roar. Regardless of how the underlying colored people are oppressed but succeeded, the elegant non-white people can't integrate into the mainstream society, and the perspective is quite unique. When I saw it, I knew it was based on a true story, even if I knew that the movie was inevitably sensational, but in the social environment at that time, the friendship between the two people was still beautiful and touching. However, the film has some achievements, and it ushered in the tears and hustle and bustle outside the play. Sure enough, it has to be lamented that the purest beauty and the purest evil are only found in works of art.

Author: 27 June 2020
Review_Url: You know what the story is about, and you know what the journey will take. You know that it doesn't touch anything too profound, but it also shows a lot of straightforwardness. You know that identity is something everyone can't avoid, and you know how hard it is to understand each other. You will naturally like the characters that are not so much like the real characters, and you will laugh with those funny or actually not so funny clips. Maybe it's just the first response to laugh to dissolve or hide other feelings.

Author: 16 May 2023
Review_Url:
I am into road trip movies. There is a correlation between road and time. Story is growing with the road. The main idea is racism. But there are another stories too such as friendship, family.. author focus on the Dr. Shirley's relationship. He is lone guy. Because he is intellectual and rich. This situation separate him from his race. But he is not belong the whites' life too. This is a pain in his soul and we watch the catharsis in the scene which tony and Dr Shirley has an argument. It was impressive.. one of the other scene which is affected me is the scene which Dr Shirley had to sit in his big room alone at Christmas. I realized family is the one of the most important thing in our lives. More important than money or other luxury things..
Finally the movie was enjoyable and heartwarming. I liked it.

Author: 4 March 2023
Review: Green Book: A Hilarious and Heartwarming Journey Through the Segregated South
Review_Url: Green Book is a hilarious tale of two unlikely friends: a tough bouncer from the Bronx and a refined pianist from the South. Their road trip across the segregated South in the 1960s is filled with laughs and heartwarming moments, as they navigate through the complexities of racial tensions and cultural differences. The film is a masterclass in comedic timing and touching performances, with Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali delivering standout turns. It's a shame that the real-life Green Book, a guidebook for black travelers during the Jim Crow era, is not as amusing as this delightful movie..

It's packed with a lot of funny scenes but the movie will also be in your head for quite a long time.

Author: 15 March 2019
Review: Starts well and goes on from there
Review_Url: With some films you can tell from the first minute that it is going to be good, well acted, well scripted, well directed. This was no exception and the greater than average running time passed effortlessly. Wonderful performances from the two leads, quite a bit of humour, and heaven if you love cars from the 1950s and 60s. Don't buy the criticism of too much predictability. Apart from one scene about halfway through where you could more or less guess how it would play out, this film surprised more than it fulfilled predictions. Nothing was more touching than the postscript. If you believe in a meaningful universe, it was as if Tony and Don were destined to meet and make each other grow.

When he got into a bit of a financial problem he had to take a job as the position of chauffeur for black musician Don Shirley (Mahershala Ali), who is gonna do a tour through deep south. While on the road the two developed unlikely friendship and all these barrier between them came down

Review_Url: Two completely different types of person who became good friends at the end after a long journey. All he needs is just a normal life style, and this is what he learns from someone living in the Bronx with any education. Author: 13 March 2019
Review: A great film in its entierty
Review_Url: Forget about analyzing a film in sections, talking about its cinematography or the production design, or the choices the director made to work with actors that may or may not have acted before. 2018 was cluttered with talks about films that pure and simply did not have compelling stories but somehow made it to the festival headlines. Thankfully, this was NOT this type of film. The fact that Green Book is able to cohesively tell a heart-warming tale of two men from different ethnicities who become friends in the early sixties USA, and somehow get the attention of even the most cynical of centennials, is an unbelievable achievement in itself. Add the fact that the script was inspired by true events, written by Frank Vallelonga's son, and that the director of "There's Something About Mary" was the astonishingly best choice to take this ship to sale, and you got something special. The film is funny, witty, controversial, and simply put: beautiful. And how about that Viggo Mortensen? The guy can go from Sigmund Freud to a hippie living in the wilderness to an Italian garbage truck driver in a split second, and you believe every word that comes out of his mouth. He deserved the Oscar for this in my book.

Author: 9 December 2020
Review_Url: Based on true story of piano virtuoso, Don Shirley's road trip through the south during the 60's, the film pays tribute to his genius and courage as a black man who tries hard to soar above the ugliness of the times. The elegant trappings of his home and his success as a concert pianist leave him arrogantly cold and lonely, but his life begins to change when he hires Tony as his road trip driver. With a history as nightclub bouncer with Mafia connections in New York, Tony is the antithesis of Don's perfection and their evolving relationship on the road makes the movie soar above the ordinary and become magical. Viggo and Ali in the main roles are remarkable, and it's funny and endearing to watch them discard stereotypes and discover their mutual humanity. What we liked best is the movie teaches without preaching, it all unfolds through a myriad of natural moments between two great actors and a strong supporting cast. An Absolute Must-See Film.

Author: 5 December 2018
Review: Very touching while still a great laugh
Review_Url: Watched it in UK as one of the Cineworlds secret screening, didn't know what's the movie about at the start and I refused to google. Turns out to be a great movie, very touching, reminded us about the history, expressed the fact in this day and age the kind of racism and homophobia we've seen in the 60s still exists are just simply not acceptable. Great movie

Author: 28 November 2018
Review: A must see movie with exceptional actors
Review_Url: More than the main topic treated in the movie, which is very well depicted, I think this movie is a must see because it brings the best from every person. It touches those sentiments and emotions that are almost forgotten nowadays, like compassion, true friendship, solidarity, courage, and obviously love. This is an story rare for today's superhero and marvel blockbusters, it's about being humans, good humans. And what makes this movie really unforgettable is the acting from these two individuals that captivate the audience, and make us feel that we are with them all the way. Vigo and Mahersala are superb in their roles and regardless of getting oscar nods or not whoever sees the movie will understand why movies last forever. This one stays forever, it's exceptional.

Author: 16 February 2023
Review_Url: I don't want to sound prudish but I don't think the character that makes the driver smoke too much is right. I know it was a time when people smoked a lot, I am one of the victims of that period. Today I stopped, after having a health problem because of cigarettes. The film is very good despite this exaggeration about smoking. Again, I don't want to sound like that guy against it, I just think there was an exaggeration in relation to cigarettes. I'm not talking bad about the film, which is undoubtedly excellent. It would be unfair to say that the movie is bad because of that. Many people had the habit of smoking because nothing was said against it.

Author: 9 February 2019
Review: Lots of great reviews already, I just want to add....
Review_Url: That Linda Cardellini as Delores was absolutely luminous and very real and touching in every scene she was in. Her welcoming hug of Shirley, after the stunned Italian family funny reaction, I found wonderful, perfect and believable. I agree with many other excellent reviews, the lead actors perfect, music great, story right on, although when I first heard the theme expected it might be trite. The only scene I felt a little artificial was the black bar scene near the end, but they kind of got away with it anyway. Yes, stereotypical reactions of southern life, but I suspect fairly well depicted when we see what still remains today. Totally enjoyable film. Excellent nuanced performances by both leads.

Author: 16 April 2020
Review_Url: The color matching version of "untouchable", a road trip across the United States, but also a human journey across race and color, identity and class. All the subordinates were respectful to Tang. Only Tony treated him as an ordinary person, gave him fried chicken and told him the real idea. It's true not to discriminate against him by not treating him as black. On the other hand, Tang was discriminated and insulted by other people. He always held his breath. The audience who listened to him could eat in the restaurant, but not as a performer. It was Tony who taught him to fight back, to speak for himself and to defend his rights and dignity. It's ironic to be treated unfairly in the so-called "high-end and noble" places, but to be respected and supported in the "low-end and humble" black bars. Genius is not enough. Only courage can change people's hearts. Since he doesn't think about your feelings, why do you take care of his emotions? Bear to push forward for a while and step back to make progress. Violence won't win you anything, but cowardice is always a loser. Only by confronting the malice of life can we defeat it

Author: 5 January 2021
Review_Url:
I avoided this film because I was dreading the preaching and 12 years-style violence.
How silly was I, this was a beautiful film of great skill and style which imparted a true story without making me want to cringe with guilt and shame. We all know full well how bad things have been and this film touched on these things whilst still telling a true story and, for once, a happy ending. OK it was simplified and dared to have a happy ending but it was a great movie, superbly acted and made one feel good without forgetting history. To be honest the relationship would have been a great story regardless of skin colour. Why the Guardian critic only gave this 3 stars shows that glossing over the more hellish details and daring to have a happy ending was just not acceptable, one has to bleed more.
The fact that it probably won best picture to appease the activists was a happy coincidence as it possibly deserved it anyway.

It hurts and pains me alot to see how world has been unfair to people cause of their skin color, faith in certain religion and those people who are different and inability to do something. People who gone through depression and mental issue also faced this kind of issues and it doesn't feels right. You can't over power people,treat them badly or make them feel neglected or disregarded cause you're superior or richer from them. It's not right, World not only for certain people. This movie will provide great deal education for those people who still keeping hateful thoughts inside their minds, World has no place for hate. I hope people's thoughts change after seeing this movie.

Everything else about the movie was good, the script, music and directing, but the second half of the movie was not as good as the first one, and towards the ending you start to predict what will the next scene's general atmosphere be like (happy or sad i mean), till you reach the final scene which is a bit cliche and very expected.

Author: 14 May 2019
Review: The green book was just an amazing.
Review_Url:
The development of the two men as they both haltingly move in a closer and closer relationship made this one of the most rewarding films of the last decade -- yes those times were difficult -- lived through them.
The chemistry between Mahershala Ali and Viggo Mortensen is charming and captivating. A very heartfelt movie, that somehow came in short, through the lack in the depth exploration of Ali's character.
A lighthearted film which manages to touch on a couple of topics without over doing it and will almost definitely have you in tears by the end.
A moving feel-good story defined by the chemistry exhibited by the unusual leads. Surprising at every turn and entertaining. Perhaps too conveniently mushy at the end, but overall a great watch.

Author: 29 December 2019
Review_Url:
This is a feel-good film about an unlikely friendship. The two main characters could not be more different. Tony Lip is a classic meat and potatoes family man who does nothing half, and dr. Don Shirley is the classy, eccentric and lonesome musical genius who is on a personal mission in southern USA.
The dynamic and dialog between these two characters are what makes the film so great. At times it is downright hilarious, for example, there is a scene where Shirley makes a saracastic remark about Tonys primitive way of describing food, which is super funny. The ping-pong between the two are great.

Author: 4 December 2018
Review_Url:
Just got back from a secret screening of this movie. Never heard of it before this evening, when the title came up I had no idea what it was about. And sometimes that's the best way, no preconceptions to influence your experience.
This film is brilliant, if you get the chance to see it when it comes out on general release, go.
It's based on a true story, about an Italian American who is employed as the driver for an African American classical pianist on a tour of venues in the Deep South in 1962. A time when racial prejudice and segregation was rife, so much so, they were given a guide book of places "coloured" people were allowed to eat, sleep etc. And even though that sounds like it's going to be a gritty story, it was really funny too.

Author: 24 December 2021
Review_Url: Peter Ferrelly's 'Green Book' is a 2018 American movie, whose genre is comedy-drama. The story was inspired by a true event where an Italian-American bouncer accompanies an African-American jazz pianist, Don Shirley, on his concert tour to 'Deep South'. 'Green Book' means the guide book that aids African-Americans to find their lodgings, restaurants, and service stations during Jim Crow in the 1960s in America. The one of the striking points of this movie is the representation of the characters. First, I was amused by the clear contrast and the conversation between the protagonists. For instance, the Italian rough guardian, Tony is repeatedly pointed out about his inappropriate behaviors by the sophisticated man, Don. Then what I found fun is Tony complains about it at first, however, he reluctantly accepts the order. There are the noticeable differences of the individual personalities depicted enough in the story, so I could understand the characters obviously and enjoy the interaction. This is a great and worthwhile movie that let us entertain the process that Tony and Don build their friendship, and simultaneously learn about how the racial segregation and prejudice were going on in 1960s, America.

Author: 27 February 2019
Review: A Perfect Picture about Accepting our Differences
Review_Url:
"The whole story is about love... it's about loving each other despite our differences and finding out the truth about who we are; we're the same people."
These are the words of Director Peter Farrelly upon accepting the movie's well deserved Best Picture Academy Award. Despite all the controversy about the film at the moment I must say I have enjoyed it. Spike Lee and other not-so-enthusiasts set aside, Green Book is the perfect metaphor; a symbol of pacifism and interracial respect that we should all take into personal account.

Author: 1 January 2021
Review: A story of a minor within a minority and a knuckle-head
Review_Url:
Once during the promotion of a movie, I heard a movie director saying something like this, "A movie is like a canvas where every cast makes their own mark, and it becomes a masterpiece only if everyone does his/her part fully."
I found Green Book like so. It tells us a story of such a time, where a minor within a minority fights for his place in an overtly prejudiced and supremacist society, and of another contemporary man whose life turns upside down, at least emotionally, only within two short months.

Author: 11 January 2019
Review: Along With ROMA and Shoplifters, the Best Movie of 2018
Review_Url: I live in Seoul, Korea, and because the current audience review rating for this film in the Daum Movie, Korea's version of IMDb, is 9.3, the highest among the 2018 movies, even higher than ROMA's and Shoplifters', I went to see it for myself tonight. I am super glad that I did. I was captivated from the start to finish. The movie's narrative revolves around how two people with completely disparate background, educational level, and color of skin come to understand each other and become lifelong friends, fabulously complemented with a plethora of humorous scenes and dialogues, great music of piano pieces and indelible hit songs of the 60s, and a timely and needed message in this troubled era that we should not build walls around our hearts to discriminate and hate other people who do not share same skin color, culture, or ethnicity. The movie could have become overly serious or didactic, but the director skillfully avoids the pitfalls and does not try to needlessly expand the emotional effects. I hope more people would gravitate to the magic of this movie, letting the message break the walls in their hearts.

Author: 24 February 2019
Review_Url:
I am writing this after just finishing in seeing this great movie. It has what it takes to make a great and genius movie about true friendship between to people which, at first sight, had nothing in common.
The bronx accent of Tony Lip and the italian way of solving his problems is absolutly amazing - it reminds me of de Niro in the movie "A Bronx story". The music played is also something that's giving this movie the greatness it deserves - the way in which Don Shirley plays with his heart and with such perfection, gives you goose bumps.
Rasism is also put in the light, but only to show people that with courage and the right people by your side you can overcome every fear you have.
A worth watching movie, it has all the necessary ingredients.

Author: 26 December 2020
Review_Url:
I'm so glad I watched this, this is a very good heartwarming film which I recommend highly.
The two main lead actors are a perfect choice and share a on screen chemistry which is endearing when it calls for and comical and amusing at just the right times to keep you spell bound.
Viggo Mortensen is so convincing as a overweight Italian bodyguard with sense of humor and a deep love for his family. And Mahershala Ali plays his role (and the piano) so well you really like the two characters in what should be a boring film that consists 90% of these two characters sitting in a car.
The journey isn't just a physical journey across a dangerous part of the US for a black man in the 60's, its also an evolution of both the characters outlook on life. They open new insights and possibilities to each other they'd never been close to revealing in themselves in the past and it really binds them in a friendship which holds true. In a way they both have skill sets that compliment each other, you have the Street smart Italian guy and the righteous courteous and kind Dr Shirley, they're both able to teach and nurture each other, and help each other fulfil their goal. Some of the racism the Dr had to endure was beyond anything we see today and shows what great courage he had in doing this tour of the deep south.
The storyline is well scripted, well thought out and excellent cast and acted. The pacing was sometimes slow, but otherwise this is a must see film and I highly recommend.

Author: 15 November 2020
Review_Url:
Racial discrimination is still here all over the world. "Green Book" just illuminate such a horrible situation and the way it gets all of this is impressive. On plot, it is properly concise and detailed, it's how a biography goes.
The movie is excellent because it comes to "change". From Doc. Shirley bending down to enjoy fried chicken, to Tony respecting Doc. not for payment but for friendship. From police come to find trouble, to a gentle "Your tire is flat" "Merry Christmas".
Everyone of us should put down discrimination, for all god's children are born equal. Racial segregation happened, and it's still happening. But not just for that, interactions among people is what counts either. And, with a happy ending, it sheds a light on the road for humanity equality. It deserves to be a "Great" movie.

There will always be racism (at all levels), but if we, humans look inside ourselves, show respect and love to our fellow humans, we will get back same thing from the others. It's astonishing the fact that we are capable for both the best and the worst things. Let's try for the first.

Author: 16 June 2019
Review_Url: Green Book is a wonderful movie. Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali are acting fantastically. It is nice to see the development of a friendship between the two main characters Tony Lip and Don Shirley. Peter Farrelly also succeeded in subtly depicting a serious and sad topic such as racism. Despite this depressing theme, the film also has some humorous elements. Green Book unites elements of drama and comedy. It is a very warm-hearted film that absolutely convinces. It also makes you think. Green Book shows what friendship and tolerance really mean. For me, it is already the film of the year. I think it has really earned winning the Oscar for Best Picture. Green Book is for me one of the best films of all time. I can only recommend to everyone to necessarily watch this movie. It is really worth it .

Author: 31 August 2019
Review_Url:
The movie was a lovely combination between two different worlds , two different mindsets ,just some different aspects of life collapsing into one beautiful story in which some boundaries were broken such as hatred and racism ..
in this kind of movies we get to see and discover the depths and asspects of humans ,the association of different qualities in one human being -and even oppsed ones at the same time-, his ability to change to grow and his will to help or to destroy others .. i loved how none of the main charachters radically changed , they simply dived into the other's culture , got inspired and loaded some of that into his own existence into his own identity ..that's the real purpose of human intereacting indeed .. that's what makes us human ,the ability to be different to be accepted for that and be accepted as well .

Review: A movie that opens your eyes

This movie points out the dark colors of the white peoples minds in treating black people. Even though they in some cases became higher in class than them in education, skill, qualification. Yet the skin of their color made white people think they cannot sit with us, they are inferior, they cannot come to our homes, they cannot eat with us. it is a journey of two minds learning from each other. Knowing each other made them point out their faults and both tried to change those faults and became a new person. this movie will make you feel like you are on a journey of souls and emotion and discovery and ofcourse, history. definitely worth watching

Author: 13 November 2021
Review_Url: That is the second time I have watched 'Green Book' and the second time I shed a tear over it. That is an incredible film of a marvellous story of a rare friendship during rough and unpleasant times in America that charms and makes the viewer immerse in it fully. 'Green Book' raises an important issue of American society - segregation - the sin they are destined to atone for even until now. That is a dark spot in US history, and there have been a number of films depicting it in their own manner. And so does 'Green Book'. Maybe not in a perfect way, but we have to bear in mind that this is a mainstream movie for the global audience, therefore made in a way to be comprehensible by virtually everyone. The film, inspired by the true story, narrates us about two men, Tony 'Lip' Vallelonga and Dr. Don Shirley, played by Viggo Mortensen Mahershala Ali respectively. Tony happens to be an unquestionable racist at the beginning of the film and considerably uncomfortable being a servant to anyone. Being temporarily out-of-work, he is hired as both a driver and bodyguard to accompany Shirley and his white bandmates on a tour to the American South, which was still segregated in 1962 - the year when the story is set. By following their trip, we observe all the insanity of then segregation policies.

Author: 15 September 2019
Review: Would you not feel good if I lied to you? Of course not, cause you're smart and beautiful.

In a well-to-proven formula, Hollywood took a character, thisted some facts, some added, some removed, and there's such an uplifting story that even the greatest cynics feel good. It's a gold standard fell-good film. Don't ya like a f...lickin' KFC? Never mind the content...

Author: 15 February 2019
Review: The Green Book was a hotel guide for negros who wanted to travel south back in the 50's in USA
Review_Url: This is the true strory of two people who come from a totally different background but even show, they get to know it's other, like each other and in the end become longlife friends. The white guy, played brilliantly by the actor Viggo Mortensen, is a really macho, anti-negro, american italian catholic who earns his familly's living doing petit crime jobs for the italian mobsters. The black guy is a bisexual, highly educated pianist who performs workdwide and decides to take on the hard task of performing at the racist South States of USA. He needs a bodyguard for that job and during the journey they discover each others personality and sterotypes, they change the way that they were used to see the world and finally become inseperable. We' ve seen this kind of moovies many times before and the message is always the same. Don't judge other people by the colour of their skin or by their education or by whatever. Despite the banallity of the message, it seems that our world has not learnt its lesson yet and a repetition is necessary. Besides, the performances of both Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali, are excellent. So it's a 7/10 for me and maybe an oscar for best supporting actor for Ali whose transfiguration from film to film is unbelievable.

Author: 10 March 2019
Review_Url: This is a tale of a working-class Italian American driver - Tony (played by Viggo Mortensen), hired by a celebrated African-American pianist - Don,played Mahershala Ali. Tony is seen to be prejudiced and politically incorrect while Don seeks to refine his language and behavior, projecting his superiority. But both men have something to teach each other, as Tony tries to chip away Don's quixotic nature, which is a poor and potentially fatal fit for the Apartheid system of the South in the 1960s. Particularly memorable is a brief scene of Don, in his suit, staring out at the plantation filled with African American workers.

Author: 23 May 2020
Review_Url:
This could have been a mundane documentary about the life of Dr. Shirley.
Bravo to the writers who dug deeper than the facts to show us that we can become better people even when we already believe we are good people.
Tony truly thought he was a good man. Donald was full of himself, but hiding from relationships because he believed he didn't fit into any one circle.
During their eight weeks of almost constant togetherness, both men learn extraordinary things.
The most obvious being racial barriers, but more than that, they learned to view the world, and how it ticks, seeing it through each other's eyes.
Ending with a friendship that lasted the rest of their lives.
Any movie that raises awareness of love and friendship is always welcome on my television.
Each character played their parts flawlessly. Tony's wife, Donald's cello and bass players, Dr. Shirley's home assistant, Emit. They all played off of each other's brilliance to make the best movie of the year.
I was cheering from my couch for all of them for winning the Academy's Best Picture Oscar.
If you haven't seen it, please do! Your heart will melt, your eyes will be opened, you'll grow as a human. It is that moving, absolutely!

Author: 16 March 2019
Review: A timely movie about friendship, encouraging battle against all inequalities - Well-deserved Oscar
Review_Url: Despite ongoing term finals at university, many of my friends are watching this movie and talking about it (some of them watched it multiple times; some even called it one of their favorites). All those buzz got my hopes up and I started to expect a masterpiece, and I was not disappointed. It felt like looking through a timeless window at a broken society clinging to false traditions. There were funny moments, and also moments which would motivate anyone. I would keep two such motivational quotes forever fresh in my mind. I believe anyone watching this film would find their own favorites.

Author: 26 March 2019
Review_Url: The title of the movie, Green Book, one would expect it to be a movie about romance or a chick-flick. However, Green Book is a movie about Donald (Don) Shirley, who was an African-American musician. The title of the movie itself originates from The Green Book which was published by Victor Hugo Green and his family. The book served as a guide as to which establishments served African-Americans in the segregated South. As such, it is no secret that this movie is heavily influenced by the series of events that took place in the 1960s. The movie highlighted the misfortunes faced by people of color during that time.

Author: 26 January 2023
Review: Only by confronting life's malice can we overcome malice.
Review_Url: The skin-tone version of Untouchable is a road trip across the United States, but also a human journey across race and color, identity and class. All subordinates are respectful to Tang, but Tony treats him as an ordinary person, gives him fried chicken and tells him what he really thinks. Don't treat him as a black person, which is the real performance of non-discrimination against him. On the other hand, Tang was discriminated against and insulted by outsiders. He always swallowed his breath and kept a low voice. The audience who listens to him can eat in the restaurant, but he cannot as a performer. It was Tony who taught him to fight back and speak for himself and defend his rights and dignity. It is ironic to be treated unfairly in the so-called "high and noble" places, but to be respected and supported in the "low and humble" black bars. Genius is not enough. Only courage can change people's minds. Since he doesn't consider your feelings, why should you take care of his emotions? Take a step back and make it worse. Violence can't win you anything, but cowardice is always a loser. Only by confronting life's malice can we overcome malice.

Author: 26 February 2019
Review: A good movie with an impact
Review_Url: I loved the movie and enjoyed every minute of it. Viggo Mortensen and Mahershala Ali were both incredible to watch. Ali had a better performance comparing to his other Oscar win and seemed like he really earned it this time. Viggo's only misfortune was Rami Malek being his rival. Otherwise his acting was also Oscarworthy. I can't come up with any downside to say about the movie but I have for the Oscar win as the best picture of the year. It appears to me that an other cliche took place and a movie about race discrimination and homosexuality took the Oscar home. Maybe Green Book is the best of the best among the other movies emphasizing on similar messages, but this award will always be a shade on it as some may wonder whether it got the Oscar because it was really good or because it was an other black/gay movie. It is a pitty because this time I really watched a good one. Bohemian Rhapsody was better though (according to me of course), but who can win against these two golden tickets that never fail in the eyes of the academy, right?

Review_Url:
The voyage of two men of two different ethnic backgrounds unfolds the story of a life long friendship made gradually while giving us a glimpse of the state of the seggregation yhat prevailed in America.
This remarkable story of Dr. Sherly and Tony set forth to deep south America reveals that true friendship has no bounds. The true human connection is formed when two people opens up fully revealing their authentic selves, fears and vulnerabilities. What other best way to form an unexpected friendship than a road trip with a stranger!

Author: 9 May 2020
Review_Url: A subtle movie that makes its points with action, showing us just a glimpse of what it was like in the southern states in the 1960s. The Green Book was a real book that Negroes had to use to find out which hotels would accept them and which wouldn't. The black person, in southern states, had few rights until the landmark civil rights bills of 1964-65. This film shows us some of milder white reaction to black people. Murders, lynchings are violence of all kinds was par for the course in these states. The movie does a great job telling a true story -- one that involved a high-ranking official in the Kennedy administration to bring justice for Dr. Shirley. The soundtrack is the worst aspect of the film. Only one song, "Slow Twistin'" by Chubby Checker is reminiscent of 1962. If the filmmakers really wanted to set the mood for 1962 they would not have used songs from the 40s and 50s and pretended that was what Americans were listening to in 1962.

Author: 10 December 2020
Review: A must see to restore your heart's warmth
Review_Url: I can't express how much this movie means.At first when I saw the cover picture I though that it was gonna be a boring movie about two friends in the road, but u was wrong. This movie covers on so make aspects whose value we sometimes forget. It touches the theme of race in a very impressive way; it it hard and real which creates an impact on the viewer, bit also subtle and discrete which makes it a factor you learn not to avoid. It shows that oppression is a human thing by this i mean that unlike other movies that show racism and/or colorism, this one makes you see it deeper.that oppression can be done by anyone to anyone and at the same time that pattern are sometimes broken and that some things can only be unexpected. This movie taught me about dignity, something i had long forgotten about as rarely hear the word. It reminded me that like don shirley i should stand for myself and that that action has a value that speaks higher than other things. With tears in my eyes i finished watching the movie, the ending shows the true gestures of friendships and it is a reminder that there is good people there, it is really impressive to see don shirley out himself out there with the risk of being hurt time after times, in that regard i can only look up to him for I like most people lack that courage in the heart. To finalize, please give this movie a chance, you will not regret it, thank you for reading.

Author: 7 March 2019
Review_Url: A very safe movie. Both inspirational on the surface and heavy in its core. The wonderful performance from two talented actors are definitely adding to the completion of the movie.

Author: 8 March 2019
Review_Url: How an individual is seen and how he's portrayed in a movie are two different scenarios usually, but not in this case. M.Ali held up his legacy with the entourage that is followed. The rest of the movie shows critical interpretation with the modern world.

Author: 15 March 2019
Review_Url: There was one particular scene in which Tony wiped his feet off before entering the bed with his wife. This clearly reflects an attention to detail in which the actor did his homework, and realized that low income people have a tendency to maintain a very clean and tidy bed in the presence of filth in their environment
